ratings.comment: She is an amazing professor and cares so much about her students. Great class if you want a GPA boost - attendance is required, but there are only two tests and one discussion post a week, other than that not much homework and no quizzes. Loved this class!

Tracy is a wonderful professor and she is very passionate. I am not a social work major, so at times this class was fairly boring to me, but her class was mostly engaging and easy. At times I felt like she treated us more like children than adults, but that is my only criticism and I think it was unintentional. She deeply cares about her students.

SW205 is a great intro class for students interested in social work. Tracy was a great lecturer, and often ended class with interesting anecdotes from her career. There's 2 exams and 2 short papers. Workload wasn't too bad for a 4 credit class.

Great professor, very caring about students and does a great job of balancing course material with personal stories from the field. Exams are easy and other grading is through a couple papers and short discussion posts. Did a great job engaging students in different areas of the field and is one of the nicest people ever :)

This class was super interesting! Tracy is very knowledgeable & kind. The 2nd half is guest speakers which was neat. Papers have strict rubrics & attendance is taken every class through Tophat, but it is worth it. 2 papers, 2 exams, & discussion post every week. So glad I took this class, it gave me a ton of insight. Tracy's stories are also great!

Tracy is an all-around wonderful woman! She's incredibly passionate, knowledgable, and has so much experience in the field. Her lectures are filled with fun personal anecdotes and don't drag on. She also genuinely cares about her students, and encourages us to do our best. She's why I changed my major to Social Work, and I don't regret it one bit!
Such a great and caring professor. She truly is the best. Take. this. class.

My favorite professor this year - she is very passionate about what she teaches, and the workload is easy. Tests are straightforward and she gives you everything you need to prepare. Guest lectures are informational and allow you to think about the different jobs throughout social work. Really just a great class. I would definitely recommend it.

Professor is wonderful, my grade was because I tanked myself, has nothing to do with her. She actually emailed me to make sure I was doing alright and if I had any resources available to help me. You need to go to lecture, if you skip more than 4 lectures, you fail out. Few things graded, make sure to utilize extra credit. Passionate lectures.

I looooove Tracy!! She was so inspirational and you could always tell she was passionate about whatever she was talking about. She motivated me to have a true interest in social work and I definitely encourage you to take her class!

(Fall 2020) She is a very good professor is cares a lot about her students. Every class she asked students how they were doing and was very understanding. Her lectures are straight forward but very applicable even if you are not a SW major. (There are presenters during the end of the course which was fun).

Tracy was super nice and respected everyone's opinions. As a person, she's a peach. As someone not going into social work, I think the class content is crucial for everyone to learn. Though, I personally was tired when she did lectures. It's a bit hard to keep up with in notes. The other half of the class was guest speakers, and it was fun.

Attendance is mandatory, if you skip a class, your grade will be affected. She is an amazing professor and is very knowledgeable. For the second half of the class, there were guest speakers almost every lecture, which was great. The class only has 2 exams and there are not any trick questions .

Professor Schroffer was my favorite prof this semester! She is super knowledgable about the material and clearly very passionate which made it much easier to learn. She is very understanding of any complications you might have and wants the best for her students. Great attitude, quirky sense of humor. Would take this class again just to have her.

I loved Professor Schroepfer so much. Truly an amazing professor, and you could tell she genuinely cared about her students, even though there were over 100 of us. She started every lecture by checking in to see how we were doing. I thought her grading was fair (though the TAs not so much..) and it wasn't a very difficult class. Highly recommend!

I loved Professor Schroepfer! She was so so sweet and really cared about both the material and her students. She is one of my favorite professors ever. SW205 was pretty easy but it was a lot of new information since it is an intro course, so there was a good amount of lengthy but easy to understand readings. I definitely recommend her as a prof!

I enjoyed this class. The lectures are interesting and the exams were pretty easy. There are two papers that are graded by the TAs. I felt like my TA was too tough of a grader and I should have gotten higher grades on the papers, but I still ended with an A. If you're interested in social work, you should take this class!

Prof Schroepfer is so amazing and kind to her students. I truly felt like she cared for my wellbeing and my learning. The information presented in this class was extremely useful in finding future careers in Social Work. 2 tests and 2 papers. Papers were graded toughly but exams were fairly easy if you studied.

Tracy is kind, caring, and receptive. Her lectures were interesting and easy to follow. She also brought in many engaging and interesting guest speakers to give a great overview of the field of social work. She created an environment where speaking in a large lecture was encouraged and happened often, but was never forced.

She's the best. You can really tell that she cares about her students and wants us to be successful in her class. There are two papers and two exams. None of them are that difficult, and the format of the exams is multiple choice & true/false. She also prepares an extremely clear study guide before each exam which I highly recommend you use.
Tracy is AMAZING. The sweetest woman I have ever met. Her lectures are super interesting. The second half of the class (after the midterm) are all guest lectures which is super cool.

Straight forward professor. Extremely caring and respectful. Really aims to engage the class in open discussion. Study guides given for each exam that cover everything! Graded on 2 exams, 2 papers, and discussion posts. Would definitely recommend if you are interested in the field of Social Work! Guest lectures cover the second half the semester!

Tracy is amazing! She is so kind and genuine. She truly cares. The first half of the semester is slow, covering the history of social work. However, exams and papers are very straightforward. The workload is fitting for an intro level class. The second half of the semester is awesome, with guest speakers each day covering different SW fields.
Tracy is very understanding and sweet. She cares about your success more than anything
I love Tracy. She is AMAZING. The class is super easy and Tracy and TAs are super nice. You'll have 3 extra credits on final so don't worry too much.

Tracy is such an amazing professor who truly cares about her students and their success. Although lecture was mandatory, I actually didn't really mind coming to class. Discussion is kind of a waste of time but that's also mandatory. Know the main points of the readings for exams. I would highly recommend her otherwise!

When I say i love this lady, I LOVE THIS LADY. Reading can get kinda tedious, but her exams are so straight to the point. She doesn't try to trick you especially on the exams. Take this class because she is so loving.

Tracy is a good lecturer who truly cares about her students and their well-being. Attendance in the lecture is mandatory, but she keeps everyone engaged. First half of the course is history of social work and then the second half is filled with intelligent and passionate guest lecturers who each focus on a different field of social work. Recommend!

Professor Schroepfer is truly one of a kind. I was thinking about double majoring with Social Work, and it was official one lecture in. She truly cares about her students, and her passion for social work along with helping others shines through her lectures. There was never a dull moment, and she is absolutely wonderful.

Intro to Social Work was an awesome course that didn't cause much stress or take too much time. Expectations were always made clear and the two papers, midterm and final were straight forward. She is an excellent professor and I would love to have her again sometime. I highly recommend this course
Very interesting class especially the second half, but discussions were a huge waste of time.

Tracy is an amazing person and professor. SW 205 is very easy class, and there is always clear grading outline and expectations. She is also super understanding and willing to be flexible. I def recommend her an her courses!

Lectures and discussion are mandatory, but easy to sit through. She gives a lot of real world examples and has a lot of stories to tell, but they are all relevant to the class. She truly cares about her students and takes the time to make sure everybody is benefitting from her class. Would take more classes with her in a heartbeat!

Tracy is very friendly and approachable, and sets her standards so they are clear. Overall she is an amazing woman, but the grading scale was a little hard for how easy the class should be. There is a lot of reading, and attendance in both lecture and section is mandatory. Your grade is based off of attendance, 3 papers, and 2 exams.

Tracy is very friendly and approachable, has very straight-forward expectations, and  presents interesting material in her lectures. There is a lot of reading, and attendance in both lecture and section is mandatory. Your grade is based off of attendance, 3 papers, and 2 exams.

Tracy was an incredible professor. Lectures were interesting with plenty of real life examples. Papers very straightforward and manageable, plenty of review provided for exams. In the light of some difficult events this semester, she took the time to make sure we all had the support we needed and provided resources. Truly inspirational.

Professor Schroepfer is great! She is very sweet and she tells a lot of stories. She made it very clear what we had to know and she clearly wants everyone in the class to succeed. Her tests were super easy. I would definitely take another class with her.

Tracy is such a great professor! This class was about aging, which is what her focus was. She has so many examples from the field, and is clearly passionate about the subject. She really cares about engaging students. All of the readings for the class are online. She tests on reading material, but a lot of it seems to be covered in her lectures.

Grading felt subjective and arbitrary. Professor clearly knowledgeable of certain aspects of course materials, but lectures sometimes had outdated information/problematic materials.  Professor was very dismissive of student concerns. She had midterm course feedback then spent lecture arguing why they're all wrong.

It is obvious from the first lecture that Tracy is invested in engaging her students. 711, a human development class that goes over the entire life course was broad by nature.  Assignments were not very relevant to course material, though. No need to do any readings/buy the textbook - some readings were online and NO USE of textbook needed for an A
Tracy is an incredible professor with such a big heart. She keeps interest more than any other professor I have had!
Tracy is amazing! She is so passionate about whatever she is talking about and always there to help.

Great Professor! Tracy keeps class interesting by using examples from her own practice as well as using a variety of lecture materials. She is very helpful and fair. Assignments are very easy, but be sure to double check your grammar and spelling when writing papers.
